security: Disclosing personal details like emergency contacts, travel precautions, and spouse information would be a breach of privacy and potentially expose the individual to harm. Additionally, the form mentions 'security regulations' and 'cover problems,' which relate to operational security and should not be revealed. Directly quoting: 'EMERGENCY CONTACTS (net on arrival, phone no., alternate action to make contact)', 'SECURITY REGULATIONS (operational talk, documents, indigenous employee hazards)', 'COVER PROBLEMS (adequacy, request for briefing on arrival, family knowledge)'.
summary: A travel briefing form for Charlotte Bustos-Videla, a GS-14 employee in the WH office, detailing her PCS travel to Trinidad on June 30, 1974, and outlining security precautions, emergency contacts, and cover-related issues.
summary_one_paragraph: This document is a travel briefing data form for Charlotte Bustos-Videla, a GS-14 employee from the WH office, scheduled for PCS travel to Trinidad on June 30, 1974. The form includes her file number, 56840, and indicates she has previous travel experience. The briefing covered various security regulations, operational talk, document handling, and indigenous employee hazards. The document also includes emergency contact information, travel precautions, personal affairs, correspondence limitations, conduct guidelines, association with foreigners, hostile audio surveillance, cover problems, and responsibilities abroad. The form notes she is traveling with her spouse and was briefed by a security officer on June 18, 1974.
title: Travel Briefing Data
